name: Ctrl+Keysmash
description:
TIL some of the first computer bugs came from a literal moth stuck in a relay: 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_bug#History

Spinning beachballs of doom spiral out of ctrl and bounce all over your keyboard. This is a good thing: hit all the moths and your computer is bug free!

It's keysmash time as you try to herd the balls across a keyboard, pinball-style! Avoid the void keys, spill soda on your keyboard (sticky keys!) and use gravity keys to your advantage.

Made for the 2020 GMTK Game Jam. This game is built for US Keyboards. UK keyboards are slightly different so keys might map a little incorrectly, but the game should still be playable.

A game by: Stella Wang, Sarah Asano, Chris Cousté, Patrick Rall and Levi Walker

Sound: EVA, DzGrimX, Rar2k
